Posted By: DoragonShinzui (3/31/2012 11:18:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I went to my local card shop, hoping to buy a Chandra Ablaze. While he didn't have any of Ablaze, he did have Chandra Nalaar. Slightly disappointed, but still wanting a planeswalker for my burn deck, I went ahead and bought her. I went to play Magic with my friends later that day, and laid down a [Quest for Pure Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for Pure Flame) and then got it to 4 counters when I got her to 8 counters for her ultimate. My opponent healed himself to 21 life, grinning because he could kill me next turn, and I couldn't kill him on mine. I drew a [Blaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blaze), hit him for just one with it, sacced my Quest, and used Chandra's ultimate to burn him from 20 to 0 in one go.  
  
I don't think I've ever felt more stupid about being disappointed about something. Chandra Nalaar = Best original planeswalker, hands down.
posts.html:
I went to my local card shop, hoping to buy a Chandra Ablaze. While he didn't have any of Ablaze, he did have Chandra Nalaar. Slightly disappointed, but still wanting a planeswalker for my burn deck, I went ahead and bought her. I went to play Magic with my friends later that day, and laid down a Quest for Pure Flame and then got it to 4 counters when I got her to 8 counters for her ultimate. My opponent healed himself to 21 life, grinning because he could kill me next turn, and I couldn't kill him on mine. I drew a Blaze, hit him for just one with it, sacced my Quest, and used Chandra's ultimate to burn him from 20 to 0 in one go.

I don't think I've ever felt more stupid about being disappointed about something. Chandra Nalaar = Best original planeswalker, hands down.

posts.post_content: I run her in {R}/{U} with a couple [Clockspinning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clockspinning)s I had for other reasons and [Lotus Bloom](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Bloom)s...one of the more fun combos is "cast, Clockspinning w/ buyback, Clockspinning without buyback, third ability" for {6}{R}{R}{U}{U} and two cards. Sure the cost is kinda steep, but it's hilarious in the late game or if I draw two Blooms and have nothing more productive to do with them.
